Shard followed Myrmidon in silence, his optics scanning the debris and
terr=
ain for anything that resembled a threat.  As they approached the
shuttle, =
he spotted the other bots watching an injured bot being
loaded into the shu=
ttle, but his attention was quickly pulled to
Hydras, who was obviously in =
charge. 

> Myrmidon led Shard up to Hydras, "Sir!" The word was most
dista=
steful in his
mouth, but he spoke it anyway. "This is Shard, newly minted f=
rom a
stasis pod .
. . " Myrmidon turned to look at Shard, " . . . at least=
 so he claims." <

Shard stood with his arms folded over his chest as he ap=
praised
Hydras, his yellow optics narrowing into a glare as Myrmidon finish=
ed
with an almost accusatory tone. 

"It's about two hours east of here in =
the forest," Shard said, then
shifted his gaze back to Hydras.  "I can take=
 you there if you wish to
see it for yourself."

Or what's left of it.
